critique: This document primarily concerns the delegation of authority related to foreign aid and export financing. It amends previous executive orders to delegate specific functions under various sections of Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Acts to the Secretary of State, Secretary of Defense, and the Administrator of the Agency for International Development. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or social inclusion. The document seems neutral regarding economic regulation and federalism. It touches upon national security insofar as it relates to foreign military sales and anti-drug efforts, but doesn't heavily emphasize it over civil liberties.
